member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.HtmlHelper.ObjectToDictionary(System.Object)
member.summary:
Creates a dictionary from an object, by adding each public instance property as a key with its associated value to the dictionary. It will expose public properties from derived types as well. This is typically used with objects of an anonymous type.
If the is already an instance, then it is returned as-is.
new { data_name="value" } will translate to the entry { "data_name", "value" } in the resulting dictionary.
member.param: The to be converted.
member.returns: The created dictionary of property names and property values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.HtmlHelper.AnonymousObjectToHtmlAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a dictionary of HTML attributes from the input object, translating underscores to dashes in each public instance property.
member.param: Anonymous object describing HTML attributes.
member.returns: A dictionary that represents HTML attributes.
member.remarks:
If the object is already an instance, then a shallow copy is returned.
new { data_name="value" } will translate to the entry { "data-name", "value" } in the resulting dictionary.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.AutoValidateAntiforgeryTokenAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that causes validation of antiforgery tokens for all unsafe HTTP methods. An antiforgery token is required for HTTP methods other than GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, and TRACE.
member.remarks: can be applied as a global filter to trigger validation of antiforgery tokens by default for an application. Use to suppress validation of the antiforgery token for a controller or action.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.AutoValidateAntiforgeryTokenAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets the order value for determining the order of execution of filters. Filters execute in ascending numeric value of the property.

remarks.para: Filters are executed in a sequence determined by an ascending sort of the property.

The default Order for this attribute is 1000 because it must run after any filter which does authentication or login in order to allow them to behave as expected (ie Unauthenticated or Redirect instead of 400).
Look at for more detailed info.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.IgnoreAntiforgeryTokenAttribute
member.summary: A filter that skips antiforgery token validation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.IgnoreAntiforgeryTokenAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets the order value for determining the order of execution of filters. Filters execute in ascending numeric value of the property.

remarks.para: Filters are executed in an ordering determined by an ascending sort of the property.

The default Order for this attribute is 1000 because it must run after any filter which does authentication or login in order to allow them to behave as expected (ie Unauthenticated or Redirect instead of 400).
Look at for more detailed info.

member.summary: Describes the render mode of the component.

It configures whether the component is prerendered into the page or not and whether it simply renders static HTML on the page or if it includes the necessary information to bootstrap a Blazor application from the user agent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.RenderMode.Server

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ValidateAntiForgeryTokenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the class or method that this attribute is applied validates the anti-forgery token. If the anti-forgery token is not available, or if the token is invalid, the validation will fail and the action method will not execute.
member.remarks: This attribute helps defend against cross-site request forgery. It won't prevent other forgery or tampering attacks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ValidateAntiForgeryTokenAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets the order value for determining the order of execution of filters. Filters execute in ascending numeric value of the property.

remarks.para: Filters are executed in an ordering determined by an ascending sort of the property.

The default Order for this attribute is 1000 because it must run after any filter which does authentication or login in order to allow them to behave as expected (ie Unauthenticated or Redirect instead of 400).
Look at for more detailed info.
